To the chief Musician upon Gittith, A Psalm for the sons of Korah. How amiable <FI>are<Fi> thy tabernacles, O LORD of hosts!<RF>for the sons: or, of the sons<Rf>
My soul longeth, yea, even fainteth for the courts of the LORD: my heart and my flesh crieth out for the living God.
Yea, the sparrow hath found an house, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young, <FI>even<Fi> thine altars, O LORD of hosts, my King, and my God.
Blessed <FI>are<Fi> they that dwell in thy house: they will be still praising thee. Selah.
Blessed <FI>is<Fi> the man whose strength <FI>is<Fi> in thee; in whose heart <FI>are<Fi> the ways <FI>of them<Fi>.
<FI>Who<Fi> passing through the valley of Baca make it a well; the rain also filleth the pools.<RF>Baca…: or, mulberry trees make him a well, etc<Rf><RF>filleth: Heb. covereth<Rf>
They go from strength to strength, <FI>every one of them<Fi> in Zion appeareth before God.<RF>strength to…: or, company to company<Rf><CM>
O LORD God of hosts, hear my prayer: give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.
Behold, O God our shield, and look upon the face of thine anointed.

For a day in thy courts <FI>is<Fi> better than a thousand. I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.<RF>I had…: Heb. I would choose rather to sit at the threshold<Rf>
For the LORD God <FI>is<Fi> a sun and shield: the LORD will give grace and glory: no good <FI>thing<Fi> will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.
O LORD of hosts, blessed <FI>is<Fi> the man that trusteth in thee.<CM>
